alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 1:11AM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lower Keys in Monroe County through 145 AM EDT... At 111 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Big Torch Key to Saddlebunch Keys. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Niles Channel Bridge, Spanish Harbor Channel Bridge, Saddlebunch Keys, Little Torch Key, Upper Sugarloaf Key, Middle Torch Key, Bay Point, Big Torch Key, Summerland Key and Big Pine Key. This includes US 1 between mile markers 15 and 34. This includes US 1 between mile markers 15 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
